Semantic Versioning Will Not Save You The widely used Python package cryptography changed their build system to use Rust for low-level code which caused an emotional GitHub thread. Enthusiasts of 32-bit hardware from the 1990s aside, there was a vocal faction that stipulated adherence to Semantic Versioning from the maintainers â€“ claiming it wouldâ€™ve prevented all grief. This post will show you not only why this is wrong, but also how relying on Semantic Versioning hurts you.
